Comment: My usual 1. Nf3 has been replaced by this more flexible move in this game.  The main reason for the change is that I can reach many of my well studied openings by transposition and at the same time can avoid the Classical Kings Indian, which has built up a ton of theory.  Not only that, but by playing either the Saemisch or the Hungarian Attack (as in this game) I am able to generate a kingside attack with the white pieces.  Enjoy!
Black responds with a flexible move of his own.
Keeping my options open with the king's knight, but also preparing an anti-Grunfeld move order.
Black is heading for the KID or the Grunfeld.
Here is another benefit to this move order is that it stops your opponents well studied Grunfeld!!
